instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
Hi to all 

i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that works perfectly fine from battery and charges from the bench power supply , green and orange present , ppbus 8.57 and pp3v42 is 3.42 but if i connect a known good (several) apple chargers i get no green light or flashing green every 3 seconds and it doesnt charge or turn on .
I replaced the dc in board and the flex cable and no change .
Absolutely no corrosion whatsoever , the region around the ISL and SMC are perfectly nice and no visible corrosion or even dust :)
Anyone have any idea ? I suspect that the communication between middle pin on charger and isl might be a problem but probably wrong .....

Thanks in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
Very likely leakage on DCIN side.
If <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> is good (not shorted), then change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
Thank you dos informaticos , I see that after 10 months I was away nothing changed , its still you who works :)
I did check the <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> for a short and it was ok , and replaced the <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and it is unfortunately the exact same symptoms , a short green light 
every 3 seconds and on the desk power supply it works just fine :)

Thanks for the reply

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
Check if <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> has correct value (ohm scale).
Also describe <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> behavior, with original charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> is 68k , <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is starting with 5,2v and going down slowly to 3.9v , with desk power supply its 18.4v as it should be ....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
Original charger is smart enough to prevent full voltage delivery, if detects leakage on the board.

Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages with lab PSU.
Also post <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86 values; measured onboard, ohm scale.
Try changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>.


"with desk power supply its [B][U]18.4v[/U][/B] as it should be"
Is that the voltage marked on original Air (45W) charger???

BTW, there is no communication at all between SMC and charger.
1-wire memory (located into Magsafe connector) is nor even powered from charger, but from MLB.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
14.85 is the marked v on the charger but on the schematics its marked 18.5 v and that was what i refered to :)
The <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR> was hard to measure .... because it wasnt there :) Put in a 100k there and all works fine :)
Thank you dos informaticos for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange problem
threads.message:
Always respect voltage marked on the original charger.
You may trigger VD0R sensor sometime and SMC refuses to start in such case.
